TITLE.P: Provision of Consultancy Services — Delayed Transfers of Care

SHORT_DESCR.P: This tender is for a single provider framework agreement whereby the successful tenderer will be asked to conduct an assessment(s) of the causes of delayed transfers of care and create a design(s) for improvements across one or more of the 3 areas of the Lancashire and South Cumbria STP footprint. Options for the delivery of the implementation plan will be included as part of this work, however the implementation phase is outside of the scope of the current tender. The final scope/detail will inform a more detailed specification for each individual assessment and design and will be provided as a call-off order under the framework agreement.

This tender is for a single provider framework agreement whereby the successful tenderer will be asked to conduct an assessment(s) of the causes of delayed transfers of care and create a design(s) for improvements across one or more of the 3 areas of the Lancashire and South Cumbria STP footprint. Options for the delivery of the implementation plan will be included as part of this work, however the implementation phase is outside of the scope of the current tender. The final scope/detail will inform a more detailed specification for each individual assessment and design and will be provided as a call-off order under the framework agreement.

The assessment and design shall identify the opportunities for improvement that are achievable across the major areas identified for analysis, propose how these should be prioritised, along with the timescales and resources required to design and implement the suggested improvements. The assessment shall also quantify the financial impact of the DTOC reduction, along with the benefits to services users, system partners and practitioners.

It is estimated that the agreement value shall be in the range of pounds GBP 200 000 to GBP 800 000, dependent upon the final geographical areas of the Lancashire and South Cumbria STP footprint to be included within the assessment. Funding has been allocated from the Lancashire Better Care Fund (“BCF”).

INFO_ADD.P: The tender documents are available on Lancashire County Council's electronic tendering site http://www.lancashire.gov.uk/corporate/web/?siteid=6864&pageid=41137&e=e

Use of this system does not require high specification IT equipment or connections, nor high-level personalIT skills/capabilities. Access to the system/software and advice is free of charge. Please note if you do not already have a supplier account on the new e-tendering system (Oracle), you will be required to obtain a DUNS number, this can take a number of days to be issued and is required as part of the system registration,therefore, tenderers are advised to allow plenty of time for registration and to do this as early as possible duringthe tender period. Registration is necessary in order to view the tender details and obtain tender documentation.

REVIEW_PROCEDURE.P: This is a competitive procurement in accordance with Lancashire County Council's Contract Standing Orders. The Council will operate a standstill period of not less than 10 calendar days between notifying bidders of its intention to award the framework agreement and the award of the framework agreement. This notification to bidders will provide information on the award decision.
